title: This Wes Anderson Criterion Collector’s Set Is 30% Off for Black Friday
description: Over the last 25 years, Wes Anderson has been one of the most celebrated filmmakers working today. This year, the Criterion Collection is honoring A
body:
Over the last 25 years, Wes Anderson has been one of the most celebrated filmmakers working today. This year, the Criterion Collection is honoring Anderson’s work with an impressive box set of his first 10 movies — all in 4K Ultrah HD. 

	Since releasing in September, it’s sold out on many retailers but is still available for an unbeatable $249.98 (reg. $349.99) on Amazon for Black Friday. Shop more Black Friday Criterion deals here. 


	“The Wes Anderson Archive” comes in a 20-disc set: There are 10 4K Ultra HD discs that contain 10 movies, which all have new 4K digital masters and 5.1 surround DTS-HD Master Audio soundtracks. Additionally, there are 10 Blu-ray discs that have bonus features for each film.

	The set comes with more than 20 hours of bonus features, including audio commentaries, interviews, documentaries, deleted scenes, audition reels, short films, essays, and much more. Each film comes inside of an illustrated book inside of a deluxe clothbound box.


						
			
	

					Criterion Collection
	
					

	Spanning between 1996 to 2021, “The Wes Anderson Archive” includes the filmmaker’s first 10 movies of his feature film career. Check out a complete list of movies, below:


“Bottle Rocket”
“Rushmore”
“The Royal Tenenbaums”
“The Life Aquatic with Steve Zissou”
“The Darjeeling Limited”
“Fantastic Mr. Fox”
“Moonrise Kingdom”
“The Grand Budapest Hotel”
“Isle of Dogs”
“The French Dispatch of the Liberty, Kansas Evening Sun”



	Meanwhile, this Criterion Collection box set would make a great gift for any Wes Anderson fan too. Check out our gift guide for Wes Anderson fans for more gift ideas.

schema.headline: This Wes Anderson Criterion Collector’s Set Is 30% Off for Black Friday

title: Thanksgiving Box Office: ‘Zootopia 2’ Rules With $19.7 Million, ‘Wicked: For Good’ Crosses $200 Million
description: “Zootopia 2” topped the Thanksgiving box office, earning $19.7 million on Thursday. The Disney animated sequel has earned an impressive $59.2 millio
body:
“Zootopia 2” topped the Thanksgiving box office, earning $19.7 million on Thursday. The Disney animated sequel has earned an impressive $59.2 million domestically since opening on Tuesday night and is expected to collect $140 million to $150 million over the five-day holiday period.

	And audiences continue to fall under Elphaba and Glinda’s spell, with “Wicked: For Good” taking second place on Thursday with $12.6 million. The film has earned a mighty $207.2 million after less than a week in theaters.  “Wicked: For Good” should add more than $90 million to its haul over the five-day holiday to bring its domestic total to just under $270 million.
	

	The two films are turbocharging a box office that was desperately in need of a reset. Ticket sales in October fell to their lowest levels in three decades as films like “The Smashing Machine,” “Tron: Ares” and “Kiss of the Spider Woman” flopped, and big-budget releases such as “One Battle After Another” failed to justify their high costs. 


	Even though “Zootopia 2” is proving to be a commercial juggernaut, its grosses will fall short of the record set by another Disney film, 2024’s “Moana 2,” which earned $139 million over the traditional weekend and $225 million over the five days. Past Thanksgiving openings of note include Disney’s 2019 sequel “Frozen II” ($125 million over the five days) and 2013’s “Hunger Games: Catching Fire” ($109 million over the five days). 

	The second “Zootopia” is dominating the international box office, earning $74 million to push its global total to a sizable $133.2 million. It is projected to pull in an additional $135 million to $145 million from foreign markets over its first five days of release. The film is doing particularly well in China, where Shanghai Disneyland recently debuted a Zootopia Land. It has grossed more than $54 million in its first two days in theaters, becoming one of the few Hollywood films to resonate at the Chinese box office since COVID — the country has instead turned to local-language productions as tensions with the U.S. have risen. 
	

	Directed by Jared Bush and Byron Howard, “Zootopia 2” follows a rabbit police officer (Ginnifer Goodwin) and con artist fox (Jason Bateman) as they reunite to pursue a mysterious new reptilian resident (Ke Huy Quan). 

	Among indie films, A24’s “Eternity,” a rom-com set in the afterlife that stars Elizabeth Olsen, Miles Teller, and Callum Turner, picked up $616,272 from 1,348 screens to bring its domestic haul to $2,1 million, while Focus Features’ “Hamnet,” a drama about the death of William Shakespeare’s son, picked up $160,000 from 160 locations to bring its gross to $480,000. “Hamnet” is considered to be an Oscar frontrunner, with critics lavishing praise on the work of director Chloe Zhao and stars Jessie Buckley and Paul Mescal.

schema.headline: Thanksgiving Box Office: ‘Zootopia 2’ Rules With $19.7 Million, ‘Wicked: For Good’ Crosses $200 Million

title: Bose’s Bestselling Portable Speaker Offers Omni-Directional Sound — And Is 40% Off for Black Friday
description: The Sonos Move speaker has long been a favorite among audiophiles for its clean, crisp sound, easy connectivity and sleek design. But at $449, the M
body:
The Sonos Move speaker has long been a favorite among audiophiles for its clean, crisp sound, easy connectivity and sleek design. But at $449, the Move doesn’t come cheap, and Sonos almost never puts its products up for sale. What’s more: the Move is often backordered on the Sonos website, and availability on Amazon comes and goes.

	But Sonos isn’t the only audio brand making great speakers these days. Bose has been a leader in the audio space for almost six decades, and its latest Bose SoundLink Revolve+ (Series II) Speaker delivers a decent Sonos dupe for more than $250 cheaper.


	Regularly $299+, a new Black Friday deal gets you the SoundLink Revolve+ for just $179 — a massive 40% discount and the cheapest price we’ve seen for this bestselling portable speaker.

		

						
			
	

					Amazon
	
					
		

										BLACK FRIDAY DEAL						

					Bose SoundLink Revolve+ (Series II) Bluetooth Speaker		

		
	

	The Bose SoundLink Speaker is a portable Bluetooth speaker that delivers big, full, 360-degree sound, thanks to its unique shape and an omnidirectional deflector that moves sound around you rather than directly at you.

	While the Sonos Move gets up to 11 hours on a single charge, the Bose SoundLink II gets a whopping 17 hours from its rechargeable lithium-ion battery.

	Designed to be used indoors or outdoors, the Bose SoundLink Revolve is rated IP55 to be dust-proof and weatherproof. While you shouldn’t submerge it in the pool, it can hold up to splashes of water or a little rain without damage. The built-in handle lets you easily take it around from spot to spot — or party to party.

	Pairing is super easy using via Bluetooth, and in our experience, our music from our phone paired to the speaker in seconds. Multi-connect mode lets you pair two devices at one time and easily switch between them to control your playlists. “SimpleSync” mode, meantime, lets you pair the speaker with other Bose speakers to create a true surround sound experience.


	Regularly $299+, get the new Bose SoundLink Revolve+ Series II Speaker for just $179 here. We like the silver colorway and aluminum finish of the model above, but you can get the Bose speaker in black as well.

		

						
			
	

					Amazon
	
					
		

										ALSO CONSIDER						

					Bose SoundLink Revolve+ (Series II) Bluetooth Speaker		

		
	

	Amazon says it’s sold hundreds of these units in the last month alone, with almost 85% of shoppers giving it a full, five-star review. As with all Amazon deals though, the sale could end at any time so add this to cart while the discount is still live. See full details here.

schema.headline: Bose’s Bestselling Portable Speaker Offers Omni-Directional Sound — And Is 40% Off for Black Friday

title: Amazon Brings Back $275 iPad Deal for Black Friday
description:
If you purchase an independently reviewed product or service through a link on our website, Variety may receive an affiliate commission.

	Apple‘s i
body:
If you purchase an independently reviewed product or service through a link on our website, Variety may receive an affiliate commission.

	Apple‘s iPad is synonymous with tablets, and now, you can get one for cheaper than ever, thanks to this new Apple deal on Amazon.

	Amazon is offering the 11th-generation iPad on sale for just $274 online as part of its Black Friday deals. The latest deal gets you a generous $75 discount off its regular price of $349 — a steeper discount than we saw for it on Prime Day. This represents the cheapest price we’re seeing for a new (I.e. not refurbished) iPad online and is also the lowest price we’ve seen for this iPad ever, and lower 


		

						
			
	

					Amazon
	
					
		

										LOWEST PRICE ONLINE						

					All New Apple iPad (11-Generation)		

		
	

	The tablet features the slim and sleek design that iPads are known for with an 11-inch screen. The screen itself boasts a sharp and vivid liquid retina display that makes it easy to stream your favorite movies or to use the tablet for drawing and sketching. Apple’s screen technology automatically adjusts the display to the brightness levels in the room, to make it easy to see your content, no matter the lighting or time of day.

	A 12MP ultra-wide camera gets you the same megapixels as the iPad Pro (on sale for $1,099 at Amazon.com), and is great for crystal clear selfies and video calls. The 12MP back camera is perfect for capturing photos, or for shooting videos, in stunning 4K quality. The iPad has 128GB of storage, though you can upgrade to 256GB or 512GB models as well.

	Battery life is solid, with Apple saying it lasts “all day.” In our experience, we’ve been able to get a decent 8-10 hours of runtime on a single charge — enough to last you through a work conference or flight to Europe. WiFi 6 and 5G connectivity make it easy to pair your device with any network, while Apple’s upgraded A16 chip keeps all your apps and content running smoothly and quickly on the iPad. The super slim design and light weight make it easy to take this portable tablet on the go.


	This Amazon iPad deal gets you the 11th-generation iPad for just $274. This is not only one of the best Apple deals online, it’s also one of the best-reviewed iPads online, with a 4.8-star rating (out of five) from more than 10,000 reviewers online. Amazon says more than 10,000 verified shoppers have picked up this iPad in the last month alone. Choose from four colors online. See full sale details here.

schema.headline: Amazon Brings Back $275 iPad Deal for Black Friday

title: The Shark FlexStyle Is 43% Off for Black Friday — Its Lowest Price Ever
description:
If you purchase an independently reviewed product or service through a link on our website, Variety may receive an affiliate commission.

	Shark Bea
body:
If you purchase an independently reviewed product or service through a link on our website, Variety may receive an affiliate commission.

	Shark Beauty’s FlexStyle multi-styler has quickly become one of the most popular hair tools in the market, positioning itself as a serious rival to higher-priced hair devices such as Dyson. And now, it’s on. sale for an unbeatable $199 for Black Friday — a 43% discount and the lowest price we’ve seen.

		

						
			
	

	
					
		

										BLACK FRIDAY DEAL						

					Shark FlexStyle		

		
	

	At its core, the FlexStyle is a two-in-one high-speed dryer and multi-styler: the wand twists from drying mode to styling mode and works with multiple attachments, including auto-wrap curling barrels, an oval brush for volume, a paddle brush for smoothing, a concentrator nozzle and, in certain bundles, a diffuser for curls and coils. The temperature regulation technology is the major technical hook—it measures heat 1,000 times per second to avoid scorching, making it appealing to stylists and consumers who style frequently or have color-treated hair.


	The FlexStyle’s most prominent industry endorsement comes from celebrity hairstylist Chris Appleton, who joined Shark Beauty as a global ambassador. Appleton, known for high-profile clients like Kim Kardashian, Jennifer Lopez and Dua Lipa, has credited the device with giving everyday users access to “salon-quality styling for all hair types.” Other professional stylists in Shark’s Beauty Collective, including texture specialists and red-carpet pros, have echoed that sentiment, calling the FlexStyle a rare all-textures tool that works across fine, thick, curly and coily hair.

	The device, which typically retails for $399, is now down to $199 on major retailer such as Sephora, Ulta Beauty and Amazon. Shop more Black Friday beauty deals here.

schema.headline: The Shark FlexStyle Is 43% Off for Black Friday — Its Lowest Price Ever

title: ‘Milk & Serial,’ ‘Obsession’ Filmmakers Drop New YouTube Comedy ‘Fly Me to the Earth’ (EXCLUSIVE)
description: Curry Barker and Cooper Tomlinson, the creators of the microbudget slasher movie “Milk & Serial,” are set to drop their latest comedy project, “Fly
body:
Curry Barker and Cooper Tomlinson, the creators of the microbudget slasher movie “Milk & Serial,” are set to drop their latest comedy project, “Fly Me to the Earth,” on their That’s a Bad Idea YouTube channel.

	Barker’s horror movie “Obsession” sold for $14 million to Focus Features in October after its Toronto Film Festival debut. He caught Hollywood’s attention after “Milk & Serial,” a 62-minute horror feature he made for $800, garnered 2.1 million views.
	

	Coproduced by Barker and Tomlinson and directed and co-written by Chris Reinacher, “Fly Me to the Earth” leans into a “heightened comedic universe,” according to the filmmakers, and features an ensemble of comedy talent including Patrick Warburton (“Family Guy”), Alexis Knapp (“Pitch Perfect”), Efren Ramirez (“Napoleon Dynamite”), Ryan O’Flanagan (“American Vandal”), Chris Reinacher (“Superstore”) and Will Angus (“Friday Beers”).


	The Silver Sail Entertainment production follows “a group of friends who believe the ultimate reboot for their lives lies far beyond the stratosphere,” according to the synopsis. “Determined to leave behind the ordinary, they scrape together everything they have for a one-way ticket to lunar living — only for their big cosmic dreams to collide hilariously with earthly complications.”

	“Buckle up,” actor-producer Tanner Beard (“Landman”) said in a statement, “Get ready to see Cooper, Curry and a ton of cameos from some talented and recognizable faces in this side-splitting story about friends saving up all their money to start a bigger, better, and exciting new life on the moon!”
	

	Tomik Mansoori and Haley Johnson also produce. 

	“Fly Me to the Earth” drops exclusively on the That’s a Bad Idea YouTube channel at 4 p.m. PT Friday.

schema.headline: ‘Milk & Serial,’ ‘Obsession’ Filmmakers Drop New YouTube Comedy ‘Fly Me to the Earth’ (EXCLUSIVE)

title: These Criterion Releases Are All 50% Off for Black Friday
description: For Black Friday, Barnes & Noble has teamed up with the Criterion Collection for a month-long up to 50% off fall sale — with all DVDs, Blu-rays and
body:
For Black Friday, Barnes & Noble has teamed up with the Criterion Collection for a month-long up to 50% off fall sale — with all DVDs, Blu-rays and 4K Ultra HD discs marked down, sitewide, and it ends today.

	We rounded up the best deals on Criterion Collection releases, including Orson Welles’ “Citizen Kane,” Spike Lee’s “Do The Right Thing,” Whit Stillman’s “The Last Days of Disco” and much more. In fact, even boxed sets are half off, such as Krzysztof Kieślowski’s “The Dekalog” and Steve McQueen’s “Small Axe” anthology.


	In fact, even the very cool 10-film Wes Anderson Archive 4K Ultra HD boxed set is 50% off at Barnes & Noble. Right now, it’s on sale for $249.99 (reg. $499.99).

	But act fast and shop now, the Black Friday sale ends tonight.

	Below, check out the best Criterion Blu-ray and 4K Ultra HD discs on sale for up to 50% off at Barnes & Noble:

		

						
			
	

					Criterion Collection
	
					
		

										Save 50%						

					‘A History of Violence’		

	
		4K Ultra HD	
		
	

	One of David Cronenberg’s best films from the 2000s gets a Criterion Collection release. “A History of Violence” stars Viggo Mortensen as a small-town family man who gets mistaken for a big city mob enforcer. His life gets turned upside down when he confronts the gangsters who wronged him and his family.

		

						
			
	

					Criterion Collection
	
					
		

										Save 50%						

					‘The Breakfast Club’		

	
		4K Ultra HD	
		
	

	The classic John Hughes’ film “The Breakfast Club” gets the Criterion Collection treatment with a new 4K Ultra HD release. Get it for 50% during Barnes & Noble’s fall sale.

		

						
			
	

					Criterion Collection
	
					
		

										Save 50%						

					‘Citizen Kane’		

	
		4K Ultra HD	
		
	

	Considered the first-ever modern movie, “Citizen Kane” tells the story of the meteoric rise and climactic fall of the newspaper magnate Charles Foster Kane. But it’s Orson Welles’ stylistic innovations that made it an instant classic, such as his jigsaw-puzzle narrative structure and stunning deep-focus camera work. The new digital restoration features three new audio commentaries from scholars and critics, new interviews and audio essays, archival interviews with Welles and much more.


		

						
			
	

					Criterion Collection
	
					
		

										Save 50%						

					‘The Others’		

	
		4K Ultra HD	
		
	

	Set in a remote country house in England after WWII, Alejandro Amenábar’s “The Others” is an early 2000s gothic horror masterpiece. It was recently added to the Criterion Collection with a glorious 4K Ultra HD restoration that will definitely put a freight in you. The film stars Nicole Kidman, Fionnula Flanagan, Christopher Eccleston, Elaine Cassidy, Eric Sykes, Alakina Mann, James Bentley and others.

		

						
			
	

					Criterion Collection
	
					
		

										Save 50%						

					‘Do the Right Thing’		

	
		Blu-ray	
		
	

	Released in 1989, “Do The Right Thing” is a seminal work from director and star Spike Lee. Set in Brooklyn’s Bed-Stuy neighborhood, tensions are high and are on the verge of collapse — thanks to gentrification, over-policing, immigration and the hot summer weather. It also stars Danny Aiello, Ossie Davis, Ruby Dee, Richard Edson, Giancarlo Esposito, Bill Nunn, John Turturro, John Savage and Samuel L. Jackson.

		

						
			
	

					Criterion Collection
	
					
		

										Save 50%						

					‘A Whit Stillman Trilogy’		

	
		Blu-ray	
		
	

	“A Whit Stillman Trilogy” features the film “Metropolitan,” “Barcelona” and “The Last Days of Disco” — which were all released throughout the ’90s. Each film examines the lives of the privileged “Urban Haute Bourgeoisie” in New York City and Spain with wit, heart and biting satire of yuppie life in post-Reagan America.

		

						
			
	

					Criterion Collection
	
					
		

										Save 50%						

					‘Small Axe’		

	
		Blu-ray	
		
	

	The “Small Axe” anthology features five films from British director Steve McQueen. The collection showcases West Indian life in London, England during the ’60s throughout the ’80s. It stars Letitia Wright, John Boyega, Malachi Kirby, Shaun Parkes, Rochenda Sandall, Alex Jennings and Jack Lowden.

		

						
			
	

					Criterion Collection
	
					
		

										Save 50%						

					‘The Dekalog’		

	
		Blu-ray	
		
	

	Originally aired on Polish TV in 1989, “The Dekalog” is a 10-episode series from Krzysztof Kieślowski. It examines the lives inside of a housing complex during post-Communist in Warsaw through the themes of  the Ten Commandments.

		

						
			
	

					Criterion Collection
	
					
		

										Save 50%						

					‘America Lost and Found: The BBS Story’		

	
		Blu-ray	
		
	

	“America Lost and Found: The BBS Story” takes a look at the collective films from producers Bob Rafelson, Bert Schneider and Steve Blauner throughout counter-culture Hollywood in the late ’60s and early ’70s. It features “Head,” “Easy Rider,” “Five Easy Pieces,” “Drive, He Said,” “A Safe Place,” “The Last Picture Show” and “The King of Marvin Gardens” — with directors Rafelson, Dennis Hopper, Jack Nicholson, Henry Jaglom and Peter Bogdanovich.

	Want more? Check out other Criterion Collection releases that are up to 50% off right now, below:


“Godzilla: The Showa-Era Films 1954-1975,” $112.49 (reg. $224.99)
“The Before Trilogy,” $49.99 (reg. $99.99)
“The Infernal Affairs Trilogy,” $49.99 (reg. $99.99)
“Police Story/Police Story 2,” $24.99 (reg. $49.99)
“Princess Bride” (4K Ultra HD), $24.99 (reg. $49.99)
“Mulholland Dr. (4K Ultra HD),” $24.99 (reg. $49.99)
“Double Indemnity” (4K Ultra HD), $24.99 (reg. $49.99)
“Menace II Society” (4K Ultra HD), $24.99 (reg. $49.99)
“The Red Shoes” (4K Ultra HD), $24.99 (reg. $49.99)
“Pan’s Labyrinth,” $19.99 (reg. $39.99)
“The Piano,” $19.99 (reg. $39.99)
“The Virgin Suicides,” $19.99 (reg. $39.99)
“Fantastic Mr. Fox,” $19.99 (reg. $39.99)

schema.headline: These Criterion Releases Are All 50% Off for Black Friday

title: ‘The Kartli Kingdom’ Review: Georgian Refugees Live Decades in Limbo in an Elegiac Observational Study
description: Named for the late medieval Georgian monarchy that once stood proud on the same land, “The Kartli Kingdom” is a ruefully ironic nickname for less-th
body:
Named for the late medieval Georgian monarchy that once stood proud on the same land, “The Kartli Kingdom” is a ruefully ironic nickname for less-than-royal lodgings: a derelict sanatorium in overgrown semi-rural grounds, overlooking the brighter lights of central Tbilisi in the distance. Once home to a state-of-the-art cardiology hospital that was shuttered in the early 1990s, its wards have since been occupied by hundreds of Georgians left homeless by the 1992 war in Abkhazia — now a devastated sovereign territory to which they cannot return. Over the last 30-odd years, what was intended to be a temporary shelter has become a long-term purgatory, and that eerily stretched stillness of time is poignantly captured in Tamar Kalandadze and Julien Pebrel‘s debut documentary.
	

	The focus on families uprooted by the Abkhazian conflict makes “The Kartli Kingdom” a kind of documentary counterpart to Rusudan Glurjidze’s “House of Others,” a haunting semi-autobiographical drama that was a festival hit in 2016 — and with which Kalandadze and Pebrel’s film even shares a kind of gauzy, ghostly aesthetic. The joint director-cinematographers’ crepuscular, seemingly translucent images conjure an aptly liminal atmosphere for a study of lives lived in long-term limbo, though there’s neighborly humanity and humor amid the melancholy, as the Kingdom’s residents cultivate a strong sense of community in their crumbling surroundings. That balance of warmth and melancholy should carry “The Kartli Kingdom” far on the docfest circuit, following its premiere (and Best Director win) in IDFA.
	

	Kalandadze and Pebrel maintain a silent, discreet presence in the apartments and corridors they’re filming, usually taking a fly-on-the-wall approach to scenes of everyday interaction, while their end of any direct interviews is kept out of the edit. Drifting between households, the film is marked by a sense of slowed time, and days merging into one another, almost imperceptibly building into lifetimes. One elderly resident remarks, in a tone of weary disbelief, that she’s been there, awaiting her next move, for 26 years: She recalls when the halls were still clean and carpeted, and even a crossover period when the space was occupied by refugees and heart patients alike. 

	For some, the wait is too long. Early on, we learn of one middle-aged resident who has jumped to his death from a balcony — “falling like a leaf with everyone watching,” in the words of one saddened but hardened neighbor. Others find comfort in family, companionship and domesticity, as we sit in on light-hearted conversations over coffee, and observe still-houseproud homemakers vacuuming their fading living rooms or preparing feasts in the kitchen. Home video footage of a boisterous wedding party defies the atmosphere of stasis and decay; a shot of several burly men awkwardly steering coffin down a tight stairwell plays back into it. Cats and dogs — some stray, some nurtured — slink around the place projecting their own air of ownership, all part of the Kingdom’s makeshift ecosystem.

	Yet the community’s days there are numbered, and not because of any political progress or the emergence of a superior alternative. Negligence is rendering the old sanatorium unhabitable, bit by bit, as a widening foundational crack threatens to cleave the building in two. The authorities are slow to offer any aid or repair: The tone of proceedings may often be droll, but there’s a quiet fury in its portrayal of how these displaced people have been shunted out of sight and out of mind by a Georgian government not inclined to look back on the past.

	Another collective move looms, then, likely to an even more temporary refuge than the one in which, improbably enough, multiple generations of children have been raised. One departing family, surveying the apartment they’ve just vacated, reflects on the things they’ll miss about it. “One day we’ll say, ‘If only I were still at Kartli,'” one says. The immediate rueful laughter that follows says everything: At once angry and elegiac, bitter and wistful, “The Kartli Kingdom” reflects on a sanctuary that became a prison for some, and the other way round for others.

schema.headline: ‘The Kartli Kingdom’ Review: Georgian Refugees Live Decades in Limbo in an Elegiac Observational Study

title: The Best Black Friday Beauty Deals: Dyson, Olaplex, Fenty Beauty, Peter Thomas Roth and More
description:
Black Friday is here and the beauty deals are rolling in.

	Sitewide sales seems to be the new fad this holiday season: Kosas, Paula’s Choice and G
body:
Black Friday is here and the beauty deals are rolling in.

	Sitewide sales seems to be the new fad this holiday season: Kosas, Paula’s Choice and Glossier are all at least 20% off while bigger retailers such as Sephora and Ulta have deals on everything from Olaplex hair products to Dr. Dennis Gross peel patches.

	Check out all the best Black Friday deals below:


		

						
			
	

	
					
		

					Urban Decay Naked 3 Palette		

	
		Urban Decay’s rose-toned Naked3 palette remains a beauty-editor staple, and Black Friday brings one of the best chances all year to score its soft metallics and velvety mattes for less.	
		
	

		

						
			
	

	
					
		

					Lâncome Lash Idol Mascara		

	
		Lancôme’s Lash Idôle mascara delivers instant lift and feather-light volume with zero clumps — a makeup artist favorite that rarely goes on sale.	
		
	

		

						
			
	

	
					
		

					Benefit Cosmetics Hoola Matte Powder Bronzer		

	
		Benefit’s cult-classic Hoola Bronzer gives a believable, sun-warmed contour without shimmer, making it a perennial bestseller whenever it’s discounted.	
		
	

		

						
			
	

	
					
		

					Peter Thomas Roth Eye Patches		

	
		Peter Thomas Roth’s bestselling under-eye patches—beloved for de-puffing and smoothing in minutes—are a rare luxury find to grab during peak deal season.	
		
	

		

						
			
	

	
					
		

					Peter Thomas Roth Hydrating Moisturizer		

	
		This hyaluronic-packed Peter Thomas Roth moisturizer is a hydration workhorse, known for delivering plump, glass-skin bounce at a reliably steep Black Friday markdown.	
		
	

		

						
			
	

	
					
		

					Gucci Bloom 		

	
		Gucci Bloom’s rich, modern floral — with jasmine, tuberose and Rangoon — is a designer fragrance win when holiday discounts hit.	
		
	

		

						
			
	

	
					
		

					Laura Geller Blush		

	
		Laura Geller’s baked blush adds a soft-focus glow that flatters every skin tone, and Black Friday is one of the few times the fan-favorite formula drops in price.	
		
	


						
			
	

	
					

		

			
			
			
			
	

	
					
		

					Paula’s Choice Skin Perfecting Exfoliant		

	
		This leave-on gel exfoliant removes layers of dull skin, shrinking clogged pores and diminishing wrinkles in the process. Check out the full Paula’s Choice Black Friday sale here. 	
		
	

		

			
			
			
			
	

	
					
		

					Olaplex No. 7 Bonding Oil		

	
		Olaplex’s bond-repairing formula is so good it got its own profile in the New York Times. The No. 7 Bonding Oil is one of their newer releases and already one of their top-selling products. The buildable oil is nfused with bond building technology to strengthen and protect hair from everyday damage. It’s now 30% off on Amazon for Black Friday	
		
	

		

			
			
			
			
	

	
					
		

					Sunday Riley CEO Glow Vitamin C Face Oil		

	
		Achieve a red carpet-worthy glow with Sunday Riley’s award-winning Vitamin C serum, which packs in antioxidants to reduce signs of aging, plumps and firms the appearance of lines and wrinkles and brightens dark spots.	
		
	

		

			
			
			
			
	

	
					
		

					 Maison Margiela Replica		

	
		Maison Margiela’s Replica is one of the most popular scents to be released this past year, and now it’s cheaper than we’ve ever seen it. The woody, spicy cologne is perfect for the winter months, with notes of leather, tobacco, rum and vetiver. Yum. Shop through more of the best perfumes of 2025 here.	
		
	

		

			
			
			
			
	

	
					
		

					Kiehl’s Moisturizing Cream 		

	
		Bring the Equinox spa to your home with Kiehl’s headlining product: the creamiest, most moisturizing lotion in all of the land.	
		
	

		

			
			
			
			
	

	
					
		

					Solawave Skincare Wand		

	
		 The Advanced Skincare Wand with Red Light Therapy is Solawave’s most popular tool, promising an at-home facial through four powerful skincare technologies. First, microcurrents stimulate the muscles and deeper layers of skin, helping to reduce signs of aging, coupled with a gentle massage that decreases puffiness and dark circles. The entire time, the wand emits red light that’s clinically proven to rejuvenate the skin, and therapeutic warmth helps increase the absorption of skincare products, reduces redness and supports glowing skin.	
		
	

		

			
			
			
			
	

	
					
		

					Fenty Beauty Gloss Bomb		

	
		Fenty Beauty’s entire site is 30% off for Black Friday, with some bestsellers like their Gloss Bomb with even steeper discounts. The pucker is down to $11 today.	
		
	

		

			
			
			
			
	

	
					
		

					Hero Cosmetics Mighty Patch		

	
		Customers claim that Hero Cosmetics’ Mighty Patches are the only pimple patches that actually work, which uses the hero ingredient of Hydrocolloid to heal blemishes overnight.	
		
	

		

			
			
			
			
	

	
					
		

					Kosas Revealer Concealer		

	
		Kosas is the mystery product behind every enviable “no-makeup-makeup-look” you see on your social feeds. The clean makeup brand’s entire site is 25% off for Black Friday but we already have the TikTok viral concealer in our carts.

schema.headline: The Best Black Friday Beauty Deals: Dyson, Olaplex, Fenty Beauty, Peter Thomas Roth and More

title: The Best Black Friday Deals to Shop Today: Apple, Nespresso, Le Creuset, Ray-Ban and More
description:
If you purchase an independently reviewed product or service through a link on our website, Variety may receive an affiliate commission.

	Black Fri
body:
If you purchase an independently reviewed product or service through a link on our website, Variety may receive an affiliate commission.

	Black Friday is here and it retailers are pushing out some of the best deals we’ve seen all year in order to gain a competitive edge this holiday season.

	Some of the best deals include tech like JBL’s Tune Buds (50% off) and Amazon’s Fire HD 10 Tablet (43% off), kitchen items like this Nespresso machine (35% off) and Always Pan (37% off) and TVs like the Samsung Frame, down to an unbeatable $797. 


	Scroll down to see a full list of all the Black Friday deals to shop today:


		

						
			
	

	
					
		

					Marshall Major V Headphones		

	
		Marshall’s latest on-ear cans get one of their steepest markdowns of the season, oferring the brand’s signature headphones for less than $100. The Major V delivers more than 100 hours of wireless playtime, a warmer low end than previous generations and customizable EQ through the Marshall app.	
		
	

		

						
			
	

	
					
		

					Apple 11-inch iPad		

	
		Apple’s 11-inch iPad sees a notable and rare price drop for Black Friday. The lightweight release runs on Apple’s latest chip for smooth editing and app multitasking, with a vivid Liquid Retina display that’s ideal for watching dailies, reading scripts or handling everyday workflows on the go. 	
		
	

		

						
			
	

	
					
		

					Meta Ray-Ban Wayfarer Glasses		

	
		The buzziest wearable of the year gets a rare holiday discount. Meta’s second-gen smart Ray-Bans pack upgraded cameras, clearer audio and hands-free livestreaming into the classic Wayfarer silhouette.With improved microphones and Meta AI built in, the glasses double as a discreet content-capture tool for creators and a surprisingly capable everyday accessory. 	
		
	

		

						
			
	

	
					
		

					Magic Bullet Blender, Small, Silver, 11 Piece Set		

	
		Nutribullet is rarely on sale, at least for more than 25% off, and now their most popular product, The Magic Bullet, is down to less than $30. The The magic bullet chops, mixes, blends, whips, grinds and more. Cups are made out of high-impact plastic.Effortlessly create your favorite meals and snacks like smoothies, omelets, sauces and dips. 250 watts high-torque power base. Included recipe book gets you started making quick, easy, and delicious dishes from appetizers to desserts. Add 1/2 cup water for smooth blend for vegetables.	
		
	

		

			
			
			
			
	

	
					
		

					Philips 3200 Series Fully Automatic Espresso Machine		

	
		Philips’ fan-favorite automatic espresso maker has dropped to its lowest prices of the year, bringing café-level drinks to home kitchens without the barista learning curve. The 3200 Series grinds beans fresh for every cup and delivers five one-touch drinks — espresso, latte, cappuccino, Americano and regular coffee — with a built-in milk frother that’s shockingly consistent.	
		
	

		

						
			
	

	
					
		

					Beats Studio Pro Wireless Bluetooth Noise Cancelling Headphones		

	
		The Beats Studio Pro headphones, more than 50% off right now on Best Buy, feature the brand’s proprietary chip for better-than-ever performance: think bigger, bolder bass; less distortion; and 360-like sound with Beats’ “spatial audio” capabilities. These are also noise-cancelling headphones, with Beats’ ANC tech constantly monitoring the environment around you to reduce distracting outside noise.	
		
	

		

			
			
			
			
	

	
					
		

					Waterpik Sonic-Fusion Flosser		

	
		No one ever regrets buying a water flosser, which uses a stream of high-pressure pulsating water to remove dental plaque and food debris. The Waterpik is dentist-recommended, features 10 settings for a custom clean and is a No. 1 bestseller on Amazon.	
		
	

		

			
			
			
			
	

					Katie Ann Lehman
	
					
		

					Google Nest Wi-Fi Video Doorbell and Nest Hub Max Smart Display Bundle		

	
		The Google Nest Wi‑Fi Video Doorbell and Nest Hub Max bundle lets you see, hear, and speak to visitors from anywhere. The battery-operated doorbell delivers clear video and alerts straight to your phone, while the Nest Hub Max Smart Display gives you hands-free control with Google Assistant and a big screen for monitoring your home. These bundles are already selling out, making now the perfect time to secure yours.	
		
	

		

			
			
			
			
	

	
					
		

					Solawave Skincare Wand		

	
		 The Advanced Skincare Wand with Red Light Therapy is Solawave’s most popular tool, promising an at-home facial through four powerful skincare technologies. First, microcurrents stimulate the muscles and deeper layers of skin, helping to reduce signs of aging, coupled with a gentle massage that decreases puffiness and dark circles. The entire time, the wand emits red light that’s clinically proven to rejuvenate the skin, and therapeutic warmth helps increase the absorption of skincare products, reduces redness and supports glowing skin.	
		
	

		

			
			
			
			
	

	
					
		

					Samsung 43 Inch The Frame 4K Smart Quantum HDR TV 		

	
		If you’ve been thinking about finally indulging in the Samsung Frame, now is the time to bite the bullet. The fan-favorite Smart TV features QLED 4K TV with 100% color volume, Quantum HDR, art mode and anti-reflection with matte display. Check out more TV deals here.	
		
	

		

			
			
			
			
	

					Katie Ann Lehman
	
					
		

					Meta – Quest 3S — The Walking Dead: Saints & Sinners Bundle		

	
		The Meta Quest 3S — The Walking Dead: Saints & Sinners Bundle is $50 off, and the full game comes included with the headset. You can dive into the story-driven, combat-heavy world as soon as you set it up, with the Quest 3S delivering sharp visuals, quick load times, and an easy all-in-one setup. It’s a straightforward way to get the headset and a complete VR experience at once.	
		
	

		

			
			
			
			
	

	
					
		

					Amazon Fire HD 10 tablet 		

	
		The Fire Tablet features a 10.1-inch full HD display with more than two million dazzling pixels — and it’s currently the lowest price we’ve seen all year, including Prime Day. With up to 12 hours of battery life, meantime, the Amazon Fire Tablet beats the iPad by two extra hours, letting you spend more time connected to your device and less time waiting for it to charge.	
		
	

		

						
			
	

	
					
		

					Amazon Fire TV Stick 4K 		

	
		Get access to all your favorite streaming apps in one easy device. This Fire TV Stick supports content in up to 4K quality.	
		
	

		

						
			
	

					Katie Ann Lehman
	
					
		

					Samsung – T9 Portable Storage Drive 4TB		

	
		The Samsung T9 Portable SSD (4TB) is $140 off at Best Buy, making it a strong pick for fast, high-capacity storage. It delivers speeds up to 2,000MB/s through USB 3.2 Gen2, all in a compact black design that’s easy to carry for backups, large files, and on-the-go work. It’s a great deal if you’re handling big photo, video, or project files and want quick, reliable storage that frees up space on your devices.	
		
	

		

			
			
			
			
	

	
					
		

					JBL Tune Flex – True Wireless Noise Cancelling Earbuds 		

	
		Get these top-rated JBL earbuds for under $50 — an almost-unheard of price for noise cancelling buds. The earbuds deliver crisp, clear audio, two types of noise cancellation, and up to 32 hours of battery life with the included charging case.	
		
	

		

			
			
			
			
	

	
					
		

					Shark Cordless Vertex Pro Lightweight Cordless Stick Vacuum 		

	
		You get the same power and cleaning performance as a full size vacuum with the slim, sleek and cordless Vertex Pro. The lightweight stick vacuum contains up to a full hour of runtime and comes with duoclean powerfins that deliver nonstop contact to pick up more in every pass, and a self-cleaning brushroll for powerful pet hair retrieval. Plus, it’s designed with a IQ display with real-time readouts on runtime and performance; a multiflex technology that helps clean hard-to-reach places; and a removable hand vac for above-floor cleaning. Check out more Shark deals here.
		
	

		

			
			
			
			
	

					Katie Ann Lehman
	
					
		

					Blink Outdoor 4 – Wireless Smart Security Camera		

	
		The Blink Outdoor 4 (3-camera pack) is $115 off right now, delivering wireless security with 1080p HD video and up to two years of battery life. The included Sync Module Core makes setup simple, while the three cameras let you keep an eye on your home’s key areas. Perfect for anyone who wants hassle-free, reliable outdoor monitoring. Buy now and get a $10 e-gift card from Best Buy.	
		
	

		

						
			
	

	
					
		

					Nespresso Vertuo Plus Coffee and Espresso Maker 		

	
		The Nespresso Vertuo, one of the newest machines and a No. 1 best-seller on the retailer, is down to $142. The most compact out of the Nespresso line, the Vertuo packs the company’s impressive centrifusion technology into a sleek and slim build. Once you insert the capsule, the patented extraction technology spins it up to 7,000 rotations per minute, blending ground coffee with water to achieve barista-grade texture and quality. Check out more Nespresso deals here.	
		
	

		

			
			
			
			
	

	
					
		

					Sonos Roam		

	
		You can score a rare discount on the Roam 2, with their Cyber Monday deal getting you 22% off off the Bluetooth speaker (you can also get the same deal on the Sonos website). The Sonos Roam 2 is the latest version of the brand’s wireless speaker, which is rated IP67 waterproof and dustproof and gets you up to ten hours of playtime on a single charge. The unique design lets you stand it upright or lay it flat on its side.	
		
	

		

			
			
			
			
	

	
					
		

					Bose QuietComfort Earbuds		

	
		Bose has mastered the art of the portable audio, seen in their expansive lines of speakers, over-ear headphones and earbuds that have only gotten better with every release. The QuietComfort feature world-class noise cancelling, simple touch controls, quiet and aware mode, high-fidelity audio and a sweat and weather-resistant exterior. 	
		
	

		

			
			
			
			
	

	
					
		

					Our Place Always Pan		

	
		The best part of Our Place’s cult-favorite, bestselling Always Pan is its versatility, known as a do-it-all wonder than can fry, braise, sear, steam, saute and boil — all in one. Like all their products, the pan features a nontoxic and nonstick ceramic coating and comes with a custom steamer basket, a modular lid and a nesting spatula so you don’t have to worry about buying any add-ons once you make your purchase.	
		
	

		

			
			
			
			
	

	
					
		

										BESTSELLER						

					Great Jones Holy Sheet		

	
		A sheet pan that looks as good as it bakes. This half-sized sheet pan has a custom nonstick ceramic coating for a quick and easy cleanup, not to mention four vibrant hues  to choose from. 	
		
	

	Check out the best Black Friday deals below, which will continue to be updated through the week:
	
		Fashion	

	Madewell – 40% off purchaseCalPak – 20% off sitewideBaggu – 20% off sitewide, up to 60% offNordstrom – Up to 60% offAlo -30% off sitewideBauble Bar – 30% off sitewidePacsun – 40% off sitewideUrban Outfitters – 40% off sitewideAbercrombie & Fitch – 25-50% off sitewide& Other Stories – 30% off sitewideAdidas – Up to 60% offNike  – Up to 50% offSkims – 30% off sitewide

	Best Buy – Up to 70% offGameStop – Up to 75% offJBL – Up to 50% offPolaroid – Up to 50% off

schema.headline: The Best Black Friday Deals to Shop Today: Apple, Nespresso, Le Creuset, Ray-Ban and More

title: Hugh Jackman, Taylor Swift Were Present During Baldoni Vs Ryan Reynolds Exchange
description:
Blake Vs Justin
                          Taylor Swift, Hugh Jackman Were Present...
body:
Blake Vs Justin
                          Taylor Swift, Hugh Jackman Were Present...
                          For Ryan Reynolds' Blowup w/ Baldoni!!!
                      
                  
                        Published November 27, 2025 6:02 PM PST
                                                                      |
                Updated November 28, 2025 6:45 AM PST
                                    
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Taylor Swift and Hugh Jackman were front-row for a massive Hollywood dust-up -- new court docs show they were right there when Ryan Reynolds unleashed on Justin Baldoni during a heated confrontation over Blake Lively.
      
    
          TMZ has obtained the docs, and they spell out a tense moment inside Reynolds’ NYC penthouse on April 25, 2023 -- where Ryan allegedly confronted Baldoni over a comment about Blake’s weight that he apparently took as fat-shaming.
      

          The filings say Reynolds snapped, calling Baldoni out directly... and the whole exchange turned emotional fast. Baldoni apologized, got visibly upset and even broke down -- all while Taylor and Jackman were present as the drama unfolded.
      
    
      
        
                    
                  
      
                    TMZ.com
          
    
          FWIW -- a source close to Taylor previously told TMZ she had no idea this meeting was even happening, saying she simply arrived at Blake’s place when Blake told her to, walked into the tail end of it, and only met Baldoni once in passing. The source also said Taylor was confused why Blake later described her as her "dragon," calling the characterization "weird to say about a friend."
      
    
          The source went on to say ... Justin was about to leave after the 2-hour meeting as Taylor walked in, and she was introduced to him for the first and only time. We're told all Taylor said to Justin was how excited she was to see the movie because he was her friend's boss.
      
    
          The confrontation is now a key piece in the ongoing legal war surrounding "It Ends With Us," where things between Lively and Baldoni have grown messier every week.
      
    
          As you know, Blake is suing Justin for sexual harassment on set -- an allegation he strongly denies. The whole thing is headed to trial in March 2026.

schema.headline: Hugh Jackman, Taylor Swift Were Present During Baldoni Vs Ryan Reynolds Exchange

title: Diddy Organizes and Bankrolls Thanksgiving for 1,000 Fort Dix Inmates
description:
Diddy
                          I Gave 1,000 Inmates the Bird!!!
body:
Diddy
                          I Gave 1,000 Inmates the Bird!!!
                      
                  
                        Published November 28, 2025 5:28 AM PST
                                                                      |
                Updated November 28, 2025 8:01 AM PST
                                    
              
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Sean Combs' fellow inmates were expecting a bleak Thanksgiving, but that all changed with a well-organized and well-funded plan by SC himself.
      
    
          Diddy, through his rep, tells TMZ ... he worked with an internal group called Bankroll Bosses. He and others bought food from the commissary, spent 2 days preparing it, and distributed it to every housing unit at Fort Dix.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Diddy told us, “Thanksgiving, to me, is about making sure other people eat. Everybody misses their family. People get depressed during the holidays. We just wanted to come together as a family and do our own thing.”
      

          Prisons typically do a bare-bones Thanksgiving ... running a minimal "in-and-out" service.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          B.I., a former gang leader who helped organize the initiative, says, “We cooked the food and sent it to all the buildings. Enough for about 200 people each building. It took two days to prep everything.”
      
    
      
        
                    
                  
      
                    TMZ.com
          
    
          There are obstacles ... no stoves, no microwaves, and the inmates preparing the food use ID cards for cutting.
      
    
          As for the menu from the prison itself ... turkey roast w/ trimmings, mashed potatoes, corn and desert.
      
    
      
        
                    
                  
      
                    TMZ.com
          
    
          Combs seems to be acclimating ... “There’s a lot of misinterpretations about prison. There is a strong brotherhood. We all look out for each other. It’s nothing but a positive thing,” adding, “It’s like a little bit of home in a dark place.”
      
    
          Diddy entered Fort Dix in New Jersey October 30th, to serve out his 50-month sentence for violating the Mann Act.

schema.headline: Diddy Organizes and Bankrolls Thanksgiving for 1,000 Fort Dix Inmates

title: Jodie Sweetin Says Her Holiday Wish Is For Donald Trump To Leave White House
description:
Jodie Sweetin
                          My Holiday Wish?
                          Get Trump Outt
body:
Jodie Sweetin
                          My Holiday Wish?
                          Get Trump Outta The White House!!!
                      
                  
                        Published November 27, 2025 5:07 PM PST
                                                                            
      
    
      
        
                    
                  
      
                    TMZ.com
          
    
          Jodie Sweetin was out at the L.A. Mission doing her do-gooder thing -- and couldn’t resist slipping in a few fiery shots at Donald Trump while she was at it!
      
    
          TMZ caught up with Jodie on Tuesday... and when we asked about her holiday wishes, she didn’t even blink -- saying her Christmas wish this year is to see the U.S. President booted out of the White House.
      

          Pretty clear Jodie’s nowhere near the MAGA train -- but she is hopping on her mom’s... ’cause she filled us in on their Thanksgiving plans too.
      
    
          The convo goes everywhere... from holiday drama to dating tips for the ladies this season -- trust, you’ll wanna hear all of it!

title: Kandi Burruss Says She Didn't Exclude Estranged Husband Todd from Thanksgiving
description:
Kandi Burruss
                          I Didn't Tell Todd to Stuff it During Thanksgiving!!!
body:
Kandi Burruss
                          I Didn't Tell Todd to Stuff it During Thanksgiving!!!
                      
                  
                        Published November 28, 2025 6:36 AM PST
                                                                            
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Kandi Burruss wants everyone to know ... divorce does not always = war, at least when it comes to hers.
      
    
          Kandi shared a photo of her fam for Thanksgiving, and noticeably absent was her estranged husband, Todd Tucker. So, on the surface you'd think there were hard feelings, but Kandi wrote in a comment, "Before anyone assumes anything Todd came earlier to eat with us but he wasn't there for the pic. He was not left out or anything like that."
      
    
          A good time was apparently had by all, according to the former 'Real Housewife' ... the post was captioned, "Happy Thanksgiving. I truly enjoyed my day with my fam. I hope you enjoyed yours! Now I feel stuffed like a turkey & need to lay down. ❤️🦃"
      
    
          Kandi told her fans last Friday she decided to file for divorce ... this after 15 years together. She said she planned on "protecting my peace, being the best mother I can be, and co-parenting with love and respect."
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          TMZ reported the former couple split a few months back, after growing apart for some time. We're also told there's "legitimately no drama."
      
    
          Kandi and Todd share 2 kids ... a 9-year-old son and 6-year old daughter.
      
      
              
            
              Related articles
            
        
              
          
                          
                Todd Tucker
              
                          
                Kandi Burruss
